accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Accessibility information allows researchers to understand access, usage, limitations, formats, standards and linkage or interoperability with toolsets. This section includes information about how the data can be used and how it is currently being used.

coverage.title: Coverage
coverage.description: This information includes attributes for geographical and temporal coverage, cohort details etc. to enable a deeper understanding of the dataset content so that researchers can make decisions about the relevance of the underlying data.

dataStatus.title: Data Status
dataStatus.description: This section allows data custodians to indicate the status of the data (and define a data access URL if applicable) so that researchers understand how to access the data.

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.description: Documentation can include a rich text description of the dataset or links to media such as documents, images, presentations, videos or links to data dictionaries, profiles or dashboards.

enrichment&Linkage.title: Enrichment & Linkage
enrichment&Linkage.description: This section includes information about related datasets that may have previously been linked, as well as indicating if there is the opportunity to link to other datasets in the future. If a dataset has been enriched and/or derivations, scores and existing tools are available this section allows providers to indicate this to researchers.

provenance.title: Provenance
provenance.description:
Provenance information allows researchers to understand data within the context of its origins and can be an indicator of quality, authenticity and timeliness.

https://www.w3.org/2001/sw/wiki/PROV

structuralMetadata.title: Structural Metadata
structuralMetadata.description: We recommend that sites provide a data dictionary of structural metadata that includes the following information (please see the Structural Metadata Completion Guidance for full details including examples).

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Summary metadata must be completed by Data Custodians onboarding metadata.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Accessibility information allows researchers to understand access, usage, limitations, formats, standards and linkage or interoperability with toolsets. This section includes information about how the data can be used and how it is currently being used.

access.title: Access
access.description: Accessibility information allows researchers to understand access, usage, limitations, formats, standards and linkage or interoperability with toolsets. This section includes information about data access.

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: Accessibility information allows researchers to understand access, usage, limitations, formats, standards and linkage or interoperability with toolsets. This section includes information about how the data can be used and how it is currently being used.

coverage.title: Coverage
coverage.description: This information includes attributes for geographical and temporal coverage, cohort details etc. to enable a deeper understanding of the dataset content so that researchers can make decisions about the relevance of the underlying data.

geographicBoundingBox.title: Geographic Bounding Box
geographicBoundingBox.description:
The geographic bounding box describes the spatial coverage in terms of a square as specified by the longitude and latitude values of the lower left and upper right corners.
Please enter the four values in terms of degrees North or East, with longitudes given relative to the prime meridian (yielding values between -180E and 180E).
Note that a "north up" area is described so that generally the upper right longitude will be greater than the lower left longitude.

ref: https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:location_bbox

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description:
The end of the time period that the dataset provides coverage for.

If the dataset is “Continuous” and has no known end date, please leave blank.

If there are multiple cohorts in the dataset with varying end dates, please provide the latest date and use the description or the media attribute to provide more information. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:period_end_date

spatialAggregation.title: Spatial Aggregation
spatialAggregation.description: A statement describing the type of spatial aggregation used in the dataset (e.g. region, area, grid, etc.).

spatialResolution.title: Spatial Resolution
spatialResolution.description:
A statement of the amount of detail provided to sufficiently assess fitness for purpose. Precision can be expressed as a distance, or expressed without unit of measure specifying spatial resolution by means of an "equivalent scale" with a fraction (e.g., 1:1,000, 1:1,000,000) or alternatively specifying the angular distance.

Where the spatial resolution of the dataset is not the original resolution of the data (e.g., the resolution at which a climate model was run), you can note that in the description. maybe : https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:dataset_spatial_resolution

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description:
The start of the time period that the dataset provides coverage for.

If there are multiple cohorts in the dataset with varying start dates, please provide the earliest date and use the description or the media attribute to provide more information. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:period_start_date

temporalResolution.title: Temporal Resolution
temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in the dataset distribution.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:dataset_temporal_resolution

dataStatus.title: Data Status
dataStatus.description: This section allows data custodians to indicate the status of the data (and define a data access URL if applicable) so that researchers understand how to access the data.

dataAccess.title: Data Access
dataAccess.description:
A URL of the resource that gives access to the dataset. E.g. landing page, download link, service desk request. If the URL is an email address, you need to prefix it like this: mailto:name@sample.co.uk.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:distribution_access_url

dataStatus.title: Data Status
dataStatus.description:
Please select the data status that best describes the environment researchers will use to access the data.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_status

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.description: Documentation can include a rich text description of the dataset or links to media such as documents, images, presentations, videos or links to data dictionaries, profiles or dashboards.

associatedMedia.title: Associated Media
associatedMedia.description:
Please provide any media associated with the dataset using a valid URI for the content. This is an opportunity to provide additional context that could be useful for researchers wanting to understand more about the dataset and its relevance to their research question.

The following formats will be previewed .jpg, .png or .svg, .pdf, .xslx or .docx. Other formats can be used as url links.

Note: media asset can be hosted by the organisation or uploaded https://schema.org/associatedMedia

description.title: Description
description.description:
An HTML account of the data that provides context and scope of the data, limited to 10000 characters, and/or a resolvable URL that describes the dataset.

Additional information can be recorded and included using media. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:record_description

isPartOf.title: Is Part Of
isPartOf.description:
Please complete only if the dataset is part of a group or collection of datasets.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_relation

enrichment&Linkage.title: Enrichment & Linkage
enrichment&Linkage.description: This section includes information about related datasets that may have previously been linked, as well as indicating if there is the opportunity to link to other datasets in the future. If a dataset has been enriched and/or derivations, scores and existing tools are available this section allows providers to indicate this to researchers.

qualifiedRelation.title: Qualified Relation
qualifiedRelation.description:
If applicable, please provide the DOI of any related datasets i.e. input to, output from, linked, referencing, referenced by. If no DOI is available for the data, please use a url, or the title of the dataset.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:relationship_relation

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: Please provide the URL (e.g Github) of any analysis tools or models that have been created for this dataset and are available for further use. Multiple tools may be provided.

provenance.title: Provenance
provenance.description:
Provenance information allows researchers to understand data within the context of its origins and can be an indicator of quality, authenticity and timeliness.

https://www.w3.org/2001/sw/wiki/PROV

description(Provenance).title: Description (Provenance)
description(Provenance).description: Please indicate the purpose(s) that the dataset was collected.

source.title: Source
source.description: Please indicate the source of the data extraction.

structuralMetadata.title: Structural Metadata
structuralMetadata.description: We recommend that sites provide a data dictionary of structural metadata that includes the following information (please see the Structural Metadata Completion Guidance for full details including examples).

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Summary metadata must be completed by Data Custodians onboarding metadata.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: This is the organisation responsible for running or supporting the data access request process, as well as publishing and maintaining the metadata.

abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.description:
Provide a clear and brief descriptive signpost for researchers who are searching for data that may be relevant to their research. The abstract should allow the reader to determine the scope of the data collection and accurately summarise its content.
The optimal length is one paragraph (limited to 255 characters) and effective abstracts should avoid long sentences and abbreviations where possible. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_description

alternateIdentifier.title: Alternate Identifier
alternateIdentifier.description:
An identifier or identifiers other than the primary Identifier applied to the resource being registered.
This may be any alphanumeric string which is unique within its domain of issue. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_identifier http://purl.org/dc/terms/identifier

contactPoint.title: Contact Point
contactPoint.description:
Please provide a valid email address that can be used to coordinate data enquiries with the publisher.

Organisations are expected to provide a dedicated email address associated with the data access request process for their organisation.

This will then be used as a default contact point for all datasets submitted by the organisation. However, there will be the opportunity to overwrite his value for each dataset. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_contact_point

doiName.title: DOI Name
doiName.description: All IPCC DDC registered datasets should either have a Digital Object Identifier (DOI) or be working towards obtaining one. If a DOI is available and has been minted through another system/organisation, please provide the DOI. If there is not a DOI the IPCC DDC can mint a DOI for your dataset.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description:
Please provide relevant and specific keywords that can improve the SEO of your dataset.
IPCC could encourage users to at a minimum provide tags for: assessment report (AR[x]), Working Group, Chapter, Figure, Input, Final, Intermediate. "https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_keyword"

publicationDate.title: Publication Date
publicationDate.description:
Please provide the date on which this dataset was or will be published.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_release_date
or
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:distribution_release_date

title.title: Title
title.description:
The title should provide a short description of the dataset and be unique across the IPCC DDC. If your title is not unique, please add a prefix with your organisation name or identifier to differentiate it from other datasets within the IPCC DDC. Please avoid acronyms wherever possible.

Good titles should summarise the content of the dataset and if relevant, the region the dataset covers and ideally will be 80 characters or under. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_title

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: Accessibility information allows researchers to understand access, usage, limitations, formats, standards and linkage or interoperability with toolsets. This section includes information about how the data can be used and how it is currently being used.

isReferencedBy.title: Is Referenced By
isReferencedBy.description:
Please provide the keystone paper associated with the dataset. Also include a list of known citations, if available, and should be links to existing resources where the dataset has been used or referenced.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_is_referenced_by

license.title: License
license.description:
Legal document under which the distribution of data is made available.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_license

references.title: References
references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_relation

resourceCreator.title: Resource Creator
resourceCreator.description:
The main researchers involved in producing the data, or the authors of the publication, in priority order. To supply multiple creators, repeat this property.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_creator

geographicBoundingBox.title: Geographic Bounding Box
geographicBoundingBox.description:
The geographic bounding box describes the spatial coverage in terms of a square as specified by the longitude and latitude values of the lower left and upper right corners.
Please enter the four values in terms of degrees North or East, with longitudes given relative to the prime meridian (yielding values between -180E and 180E).
Note that a "north up" area is described so that generally the upper right longitude will be greater than the lower left longitude.

ref: https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:location_bbox

lowerLeftLatitude.title: Lower Left Latitude
lowerLeftLatitude.description:
The geographic bounding box describes a "north up" area. The lower left latitude will be smaller than the upper right latitude.

see https://opengeospatial.github.io/ogc-geosparql/geosparql11/geo.ttl#wktLiteral

lowerLeftLongitude.title: Lower Left Longitude
lowerLeftLongitude.description: The geographic bounding box describes a "north up" area. Generally the lower left longitude will be smaller than the upper right longitude. However when the area crosses the 180° meridian, the value of the lower left longitude will be greater than the value of the upper right longitude.

upperRightLatitude.title: Upper Right Latitude
upperRightLatitude.description: The geographic bounding box describes a "north up" area. Upper right latitude will be greater than the lower left latitude.

upperRightLongitude.title: Upper Right Longitude
upperRightLongitude.description: The geographic bounding box describes a "north up" area. Generally the upper right longitude will be greater than the lower left longitude. However when the area crosses the 180° meridian, the value of the lower left longitude will be greater than the value of the upper right longitude.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: This is the organisation responsible for running or supporting the data access request process, as well as publishing and maintaining the metadata.

contactPoint.title: Contact Point
contactPoint.description:
Please provide a valid email address that can be used to coordinate data enquiries with the publisher.

Organisations are expected to provide a dedicated email address associated with the data access request process for their organisation.

This will then be used as a default contact point for all datasets submitted by the organisation. However, there will be the opportunity to overwrite his value for each dataset. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_contact_point

description.title: Description
description.description:
An HTML account of the data that provides context and scope of the data, limited to 10000 characters, and/or a resolvable URL that describes the dataset.

Additional information can be recorded and included using media. https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:record_description

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description:
Please provide an identifier for your organisation.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_identifier

logo.title: Logo
logo.description: Please provide a logo associated with the Organisation using a valid URL. The following formats will be accepted .jpg, .png or .svg.

name.title: Name
name.description:
Please provide the name of the publisher.

https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_publisher

abstracttext.title: abstractText
abstracttext.description: Text with min 5 and max 255 characters.

enum.Access Level 3: Safe Room / SafePod / AOC Office & Remote

enum.LESS 1 WEEK: Access request process typically processed in less than a week

enum.1-2 WEEKS: Access request process typically processed in one to two weeks

enum.2-4 WEEKS: Access request process typically processed in two to four weeks

enum.1-2 MONTHS: Access request process typically processed in one to two months

enum.2-6 MONTHS: Access request process typically processed in two to six months

enum.MORE 6 MONTHS: Access request process typically processed in more than six months

enum.VARIABLE: Access request lead time is variable

enum.NOT APPLICABLE: Access request process duration is not applicable

enum.OTHER: If the typical timeframe does not fit into the broad ranges i.e. lightweight application vs linked data application, please choose “Other” and indicate the typical timeframe within the description for the dataset.

enum.High Risk: if data was unavailable this would impact our ability to deliver core functions.

enum.Medium: unavailability would not impact core functions but could impact delivery of non-essential support services.

enum.Low risk: No student or staff impact, other processes could be put in place if work had to be halted, no significant risk of harm.

chars80.title: chars80
chars80.description: Text with min 2 and max 80 characters

enum.IP and Commercially Sensitive: Data which has a high commercial value or requires security due to contractual requirements

enum.Personal: Data that includes personal identifiers and therefore falls under the General Data Protection Regulations (GDPR).

enum.OTHER: Please indicate if there is another standard that you are using.

enum.MLS: Healthcare services : Hospital services for people with mental health needs, and/or learning disabilities, and/or problems with substance misuse

enum.RSM: Healthcare services : Residential substance misuse treatment/ rehabilitation services

enum.CHC: Community or integrated healthcare : Community healthcare services

enum.DCS: Community or integrated healthcare : Doctors consultation services

enum.DTS: Community or integrated healthcare : Doctors treatment services

enum.DEN: Community or integrated healthcare : Dental services

enum.DSS: Community or integrated healthcare : Diagnostic and/or screening services

enum.LDC: Community or integrated healthcare : Community-based services for people with a learning disability

enum.MBS: Community or integrated healthcare : Mobile doctors services

enum.MHC: Community or integrated healthcare : Community-based services for people with mental health needs

enum.SMC: Community or integrated healthcare : Community-based services for people who misuse substances

enum.UCS: Community or integrated healthcare : Urgent care services

enum.CHN: Residential social care : Care home services with nursing

enum.CHS: Residential social care : Care home services without nursing

enum.SPC: Residential social care : Specialist college services

enum.DCC: Community social care : Domiciliary care services including those provided for children

enum.EXC: Community social care : Extra care housing services

enum.SHL: Community social care : Shared Lives (formerly known as Adult Placement)

enum.SLS: Community social care : Supported living services

datauselimitation.title: dataUseLimitation
datauselimitation.description:
Term information (see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/duo/terms?iri=http%3A%2F%2Fpurl.obolibrary.org%2Fobo%2FDUO_0000001)
DUO preferred label
data use limitation

alternative term
consent code

definition
A data item that is used to indicate consent permissions for datasets and/or materials, and relates to the purposes for which datasets and/or material might be removed, stored or used.

id
DUO:0000001

enum.GENERAL RESEARCH USE: This data use limitation indicates that use is allowed for general research use for any research purpose

enum.GENETIC STUDIES ONLY: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to genetic studies only (i.e., no phenotype-only research)

enum.NO GENERAL METHODS RESEARCH: This data use limitation indicates that use includes methods development research(e.g., development of software or algorithms) only within the bounds of other use limitations.

enum.NO LINKAGE: This data use limitation indicates there is a restriction on linking to any other datasets

enum.NO RESTRICTION: This data use limitation indicates there is no restriction on use.

enum.RESEARCH SPECIFIC RESTRICTIONS: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to studies of a certain research type.

enum.RESEARCH USE ONLY: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to research purposes (e.g., does not include its use in clinical care).

enum.COMMERCIAL RESEARCH USE: This data use limitation indicates that use is allowed for general research use for any commercial research purposes

enum.GENERAL RESEARCH USE: This data use limitation indicates that use is allowed for general research use for any research purpose

enum.GENETIC STUDIES ONLY: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to genetic studies only (i.e., no phenotype-only research)

enum.GEOGRAPHICAL RESTRICTIONS: This requirement indicates that use is limited to within a specific geographic region.

enum.INSTITUTION SPECIFIC RESTRICTIONS: This requirement indicates that use is limited to use within an approved institution.

enum.NO GENERAL METHODS RESEARCH: This data use limitation indicates that use includes methods development research(e.g., development of software or algorithms) only within the bounds of other use limitations.

enum.NO LINKAGE: This data use limitation indicates there is a restriction on linking to any other datasets

enum.NO RESTRICTION: This data use limitation indicates there is no restriction on use.

enum.NOT FOR PROFIT USE: This requirement indicates that use of the data is limited to not-for-profit use, non-commercial use.

enum.PROJECT SPECIFIC RESTRICTIONS: This requirement indicates that use is limited to use by approved projects.

enum.RESEARCH SPECIFIC RESTRICTIONS: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to studies of a certain research type.

enum.RESEARCH USE ONLY: This data use limitation indicates that use is limited to research purposes (e.g., does not include its use in clinical care).

enum.USER SPECIFIC RESTRICTION: This requirement indicates that use is limited to use by approved users.

enum.COLLABORATION REQUIRED: This requirement indicates that the requestor must agree to collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).

enum.DISCLOSURE CONTROL: This requirement indicates that use must be disclosed in accordance with the data custodians policy

enum.ETHICS APPROVAL REQUIRED: This requirement indicates that the requestor must provide documentation of local IRB/ERB approval.

enum.PUBLICATION MORATORIUM: This requirement indicates that requestor agrees not to publish results of studies until a specific date

enum.PUBLICATION REQUIRED: This requirement indicates that requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.

enum.RETURN TO DATABASE OR RESOURCE: This requirement indicates that the requestor must return derived/enriched data to the database/resource.

enum.TIME LIMIT ON USE: This requirement indicates that use is approved for a specific number of months.

description.title: description
description.description: //Regular expression to validate min, max character limit :  min 2, max 3000

descriptiontext.title: descriptionText
descriptiontext.description: Text with min 2 and max 3000 characters

emailorurl.title: emailOrUrl
emailorurl.description: The entry can be either an email or a URL.

enum.0 - 6 MONTHS: Data typically available for a patient over a 0-6 month period

enum.6 - 12 MONTHS: Data typically available for a patient over a 6-12 month period

enum.1 - 10 YEARS: Data typically available for a patient over a 1-10 year period

enum.> 10 YEARS: Data typically available for a patient for over a 10 year period

enum.OTHER: Data available for a patient over another time period

frequency.title: frequency
frequency.description: List of frequencies for a Data collection or extraction.

enum.annual: Dataset publication or collection occurs once a year.

enum.biannual: Dataset publication or collection occurs twice a year.

enum.biennial: Dataset publication or collection occurs every two years.

enum.bimonthly: Dataset publication or collection occurs every two months.

enum.biweekly: Dataset publication or collection occurs every two weeks.

enum.continuous: Dataset publication or collection occurs without interruption.

enum.daily: Dataset publication or collection occurs once a day.

enum.irregular: Dataset publication or collection occurs at uneven intervals.

enum.monthly: Dataset publication or collection occurs once a month.

enum.other: Dataset publication or collection occurs at other interval.

enum.quarterly: Dataset publication or collection occurs every three months.

enum.semiweekly: Dataset publication or collection occurs twice a week.

enum.static: Dataset publication or collection occurs once.

enum.weekly: Dataset publication or collection occurs once a week.

enum.High Risk: Accuracy and completeness of data must be maintained to meet statutory/contractual obligations.

enum.Medium: Some delay in updating the information would not cause significant issues.

enum.Low risk: Data that is historical in nature and does not require regular updating.

ispartof.title: isPartOf
ispartof.description:
any of:
* url
* chars80
* fixed text "NOT APPLICABLE"

enum.section_250: Section 250 of the Health and Social Care Act 2012

enum.section_259: Section 259 of the Health and Social Care Act 2012

markdown.title: Markdown
markdown.description: A text markup format that is usually translated to HTML for web pages. More details here: https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/

enum.OTHER: Other organisation affiliated with HDR UK

money.title: money
money.pattern:
// value is an amount in £ sterling with no pence e.g. £1234.
x ==~ /\£\d+$/

enum.ANNUAL: Dataset published occurs once a year.

enum.AVAILABILITY TO BE CONFIRMED: Availability of samples is currently being confirmed

enum.BONE MARROW: Bone marrow samples associated with the data are available

enum.CANCER CELL LINES: Cancer cell line samples associated with the data are available

enum.CDNA/MRNA: CDNA/MRNA samples associated with the data are available

enum.CORE BIOPSY: Core biopsy samples associated with the data are available

enum.DNA: DNA samples associated with the data are available

enum.FAECES: Faeces samples associated with the data are available

enum.IMMORTALIZED CELL LINES: Immortalized cell line samples associated with the data are available

enum.MICRORNA: MicroRNA samples associated with the data are available

enum.NOT AVAILABLE: Samples associated with the dataset are not available

enum.PERIPHERAL BLOOD CELLS: Peripheral blood cell samples associated with the data are available

enum.PLASMA: Plasma samples associated with the data are available

enum.PM TISSUE: PM Tissue samples associated with the data are available

enum.PRIMARY CELLS: Primary cell samples associated with the data are available

enum.RNA: RNA samples associated with the data are available

enum.SALIVA: Saliva samples associated with the data are available

enum.SERUM: Serum samples associated with the data are available

enum.SWABS: Swab samples associated with the data are available

enum.TISSUE: Tissue samples associated with the data are available

enum.URINE: Urine samples associated with the data are available

enum.WHOLE BLOOD: Whole blood samples associated with the data are available

enum.nhseefm: NHS England Estates and Facilities Management

enum.ISO-incomplete: An Administered Item with the “Incomplete” status shall indicate that the Submitter? wishes to make the community that uses this metadata register aware of the existence of an? Administered Item in their local domain.

enum.ISO-candidate: An Administered Item with the “Candidate” status shall indicate that it has been? proposed for progression through the registration levels.

enum.ISO-recorded: An Administered Item with the “Recorded” status shall mean that all mandatory metadata attributes have been completed, and all associated constraints are to be enforced.

enum.ISO-qualified: An Administered Item with the “Qualified” status shall mean that the Administration Item had a “Recorded” registration status and the Registration Authority has confirmed that the mandatory metadata attributes are complete and conform to applicable quality requirements

enum.ISO-standard: An Administered Item with the “Standard” status indicates that the Administration Item had a “Qualified” registration status and the Registration Authority confirms that the Administered Item is of sufficient quality and of broad interest for use in the community that uses this metadata register.

enum.ISO-preferred standard: An Administered Item with the “Preferred Standard” status means that the Registration Authority confirms that the Administered Item is preferred for use in the community that uses this metadata register.

enum.ISO-retired: An Administered Item with the “Retired” status indicates that the Registration Authority has determined the Administered Item is no longer recommended for use in the community that uses this metadata register

enum.ISO-superseded: n Administered Item with the “Superseded” status indicates that the Registration Authority has determined the Administered Item is no longer recommended for use in the community that uses this metadata register. A “Superseded” Administered Item may be used but the successor Administered Item is the preferred for use. Such Administered Items are retained in the metadata register archival storage facility for historic reference purposes. “Superseded” Administered Items should include a reference to replacement Administered Items when appropriate.

enum.ISO-historical: An Administered Item with the “Historical” status shall indicate that the Submitter wishes to make the community that uses this metadata register aware of the existence of an item that was used in the past and has not been used recently

enum.ISO-application: An Administered Item with the “Application” status shall mean that the Registration Authority wishes to make the community that uses this metadata register aware of the existence of an Administered Item in their local domain that is used by an application system. This item may be very well described

enum.HL7-Normative: This content was approved by the ANSI standards process icon in a previous version (see Normative status note). It has been subject to review and production implementation in a wide variety of environments. The content is considered to be stable and has been 'locked', subjecting it to FHIR Inter-version Compatibility Rules. While changes are possible, they are expected to be infrequent and are tightly constrained.

enum.HL7-Trial use: This content has been well reviewed and is considered by the authors to be ready for use in production systems. It has been subjected to ballot and approved as an official standard. However, it has not yet seen widespread use in production across the full spectrum of environments it is intended to be used in. In some cases, there may be documented known issues that require implementation experience to determine appropriate resolutions for. Future versions of FHIR may make significant changes to Trial Use content that are not compatible with previously published content.

enum.HL7-Draft: This portion of the specification is not considered to be complete enough or sufficiently reviewed to be safe for implementation. It may have known issues or still be in the ""in development"" stage. It is included in the publication as a place-holder, to solicit feedback from the implementation community and/or to give implementers some insight as to functionality likely to be included in future versions of the specification. Content at this level should only be implemented by the brave or desperate and is very much ""use at your own risk"". The content that is Draft that will usually be elevated to Trial Use once review and correction is complete after it has been subjected to ballot. Some resources with a standards status of 'draft' have an FMM level of 1 or 2 - this means that the committee responsible for them is ready for them to be tested and balloting, but that balloting has not yet occurred. Draft resources cannot have a FMM level greater than 2.

enum.HL7-Informative: This portion of the specification is provided for implementer assistance and does not make rules that implementers are required to follow. Typical examples of this content in the FHIR specification are tables of contents, registries, examples, and implementer advice

enum.HL7-Deprecated: This portion of the specification is outdated and may be withdrawn in a future version. Implementers who already support it should continue to do so for backward compatibility. Implementers should avoid adding new uses of this portion of the specification. The specification should include guidance on what implementers should use instead of the deprecated portion

roleType.title: Role Type
roleType.description: A role type of the concept, link or resource being referred to. For example adopter, user etc.. This can also support type of the resource such as Training, or example

enum.Developer: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Contributor: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Adopter: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Pilot member: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Reviewer: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Advisor: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Consulted: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.User: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Supplier: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Customer: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Stakeholder: Role of a body such as an organisation

enum.Member: Role of a body such as an organisation

semver.title: semver
semver.description: A representation of semver used to describe a version.

enum.CLINIC: Specific clinic such as antenatal clinic

enum.SERVICES: Services such as drug misuse or blood transfusion

shortabstracttext.title: shortAbstractText
shortabstracttext.description: //Regular expression (regex) to validate and constrain title between 3 and 255 characters

enum.Safe Rooms, SafePods: Access through ONS Safe Rooms, SafePods

enum.Assured Organisational Connectivity – re: Access through temporary Assured Organisational Connection via remote access

enum.draft: Draft resource prepared for general feedback before testing phase

enum.alpha: Resource prepared to identify and test assumptions during alpha

enum.beta: Resource prepared to test implementation and integration in beta

enum.implementation: Resource prepared for final release and implementation

enum.maintenance: Maintenance resource prepared to iterate and improve

enum.deprecated: Deprecated resources are no longer recommended for use, such as historical versions

enum.retired: Retired resources should not be used and are no longer supported. They are only available for archival purposes only.

timelag.title: timeLag
timelag.description: The typical time lag between an event and the data for that event appearing in the dataset

enum.LESS 1 WEEK: Typical time lag of less than a week

enum.1-2 WEEKS: Typical time lag of one to two weeks

enum.2-4 WEEKS: Typical time lag of two to four weeks

enum.1-2 MONTHS: Typical time lag of one to two months

enum.2-6 MONTHS: Typical time lag of two to six months

enum.6 MONTHS PLUS: Typical time lag of more than six months
